RYHHwVK5wZeFJyDF42m9FQ.text: Great shop with friendly staff. Stopped in for a quick Sunday lunch. Roast beef sandwich was very good. Certainly a good spot for a light lunch and a beer.

JXAx3cjz24BZqabi3Kx0dA.text: Great, calming atmosphere.  Food was great- I had the grilled cheese, and my wife has the Americano.  Both were fantastic.  What sets this place apart is the attention to detail.  From the absolutely fantastic service, to the antique water glasses- this place does it right.  You can tell that the owner takes extreme pride in his business, and his staff was very attentive.  I would recommend!

L6GC-oSl0yKKoDphwGwxrQ.text: We were so excited to try this place in Matthews! We were waiting for a place like this to open up for a while. The food and charcuterie board was so good and the wait staff and owner were so wonderful! They were so accommodating and have great beer and wine choices! If you haven't been here yet, check it out you won't be disappointed!!!

5shgYV7hxn6lBI-0t8GYqw.text: this cheese bar = the best!!!  location = perfect!  "loyalist" = brilliant!  locally sourcing = tops!  i can't say enough...just go!

hq8FwVAx6nXekTAJAslf1w.text: Amazing sandwiches. Get the chipotle turkey bacon.  Excellent service.  Cool casual vibe

7J8kxcm4ZDn6Uy2Fb46r5Q.text: Awesome drinks, food and service. Glad it's finally open and in Matthews! It's like dean and deluca. Has great variety.

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. The cheese and meat plate is fantastic they also have really nice catering to services that you normally not find and Matthews.
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Awesome sandwiches, drinks and service. Happy to this type of place finally make it to Matthews.

O37yGnwWbQRPF3PCVY3nuw.text: This place is the best I've found in the Charlotte area if you want a cheese and charcuterie plate. The owner took time to explain the differences in each of the products, and let us sample things before we committed to our purchase. I won't go anywhere else when I am considering a cheese plate for a special occasion. Would be a great place to take a date as well.

QKlvnD4uFK1BkeUsmpDJdA.text: This was a great find. Excellent service. Friendly and welcoming.  Excellent food and drinks.  Quality,Presentation and plain yummy. GO!

2Y6pJ-_YxzpbCwroLrMJgg.text: Our charcuterie & cheese board was wonderful -- high quality ingredients and great pairings. The staff were knowledgeable about the food, and the owner recommended the perfect beer pairing. We like to sit at bars and talk with owners, and this place is great for that. No matter where you sit, including outside, it's a great place for a date. My ONLY suggestion is better ventilation given some fumes from cooking. I cant wait to come back here again!

yJcUU0yhRQy3C2KQF3AAmw.text: Ah, The Loyalist - well worth the drive to Matthews for this south ender.  Simply stunning sandwiches - from the Reuben to the Muffaletta to the Grilled Cheese, you will be bowled over by the owner's uncanny ability to pick just the right mix and amount of ingredients to elevate the mere sandwich to a heavenly experience.   Grab a cider from Botanist and Barrel while you're there - the Emanation or any of their sours provide a wonderful way to wash your delish sandwich down.  And that doesn't even BEGIN to say how fabulous their charcuterie boards are - such amazing choices and pairings of cheeses, meats, olives - oh my!  Friendly and passionate owners, sleek indoor digs as well as a cool patio - this place is a jewel.

Rber8NsuoPSo0kkPu3Fb1Q.text: This place is miraculous. The owner really knows & loves charcuterie & you can tell by the carefully selected items stocked in this precious meat & cheese shop. Charlotte foodies at long last have one place where they can find great imported & local cheese, cured meats, pickles, sauces, salts, chocolates, oils, crackers, beer & sodas... They serve salads & sandwiches made with great care. This place just ramped up this towns foodie factor by an entire letter grade.

EURDUsBzAVfVTuCYNeNsww.text: First off, customer service is great. The owner came out and talked to us, the wait staff was very friendly and it made for a fun and enjoyable experience. Patio area is great - and they have heaters for the cooler weather!  They change their cheese boards almost daily so you shouldn't get board. The blue cheese was amazing and they have a great wine and beer list. This place is new but I hope it stays around!!! Will definitely be coming back.

62MXgzS4EfMXRW0tPTMpMw.text: The loyalist market is a super comforting local place. It has amazing sandwiches and food. Also supports little companies. I would really recommend going here

X-eDF-2mPVJ8Jf71aeFurw.text: The Loyalist is a great little spot!  It has a cool vibe.  If you want to grab a drink from the cooler or take a sandwich to go it's a good choice.  The waitress was really nice and attentive.  The grilled cheese was amazing!!  Definitely a spot to try!  Matthews has come along way with cool breweries and restaurants to try.

AjGNQ7-FVWsARwDezxG1jQ.text: Knowledgeable staff.  Local foods along with artisinal cheeses and charcuterie.  They have cool and fun events regularly.  Can't wait until the weather warms up so we can enjoy their patio.

7N8adwAnULKPW58VxS9cmw.text: Cool spot.  Lots of meats and cheeses, great for lunch or to get stocked up before your dinner party.

0U0UbroojI8q18DZFx6V-w.text: Loved the pork rinds w pimento cheese!!!! And the cake... delicious!!! Great service. Would make a great girls nite!!

5b5WgkUBhobeHpYkYPrs7A.text: Amazing place! We found this randomly and were blown away.  Very comfortable atmosphere and extremely clean and inviting.  My wife and I loved the menu and local they also have a solid drink selection.  The sand which special was perfect and the customer service was next level.  It was my wife's birthday and our waitress (forgot her name unfortunately but she rules) was so nice and got us a piece of chocolate cake on the house.  Love that this place is crushing it.  Will be coming back a lot.

5C_g0ffyxo-v_RTPKifRQg.text: Best charcuterie in Charlotte! Love this place, and their sandwiches are delicious. Love their staff, too - super friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.

2AlP3rAIlrXpjJJd9Y2sZg.text: Delicious and well selected meats and cheeses. Seating (lack of tables) and service (a little snooty) leave much to be desired, but I think that will improve as they learn. Hoping the kinks are just being worked out. The boards could be better portions for the price, but I'm so happy to have a place like this here in Charlotte. I really hope this review is constructive because this has sooo much potential with a few tweaks.

fPr5PhtUNFoOnNAH3sWzJw.text: Have been following The Loyalist Market since they opened and finally got by there today and was NOT disappointed! Chris and everyone there were so nice and so helpful with cheese tasting and selection! The Ruben and grilled cheese sandwiches were amazing! Loved the beer and wine selection. So glad they're here! We'll be back!!

vlscsgmDvhzjGjx4dYhahg.text: Wonderful variety of local and imported cheeses and meats! Lots of gourmet and specialty items!

em-7wnddNXiVPJwPo2_6ig.text: New establishment in Matthews. Excellent selection of domestic cheeses. Haven't had s chance to check out the charcuterie yet. They also prepare trays and sandwiches, etc for eating in or take away. Will definitely be heading back with holidays coming up.

J3myWwORsy2VYPiksvFSzg.text: Great concept in Matthews that just opened!  Very nice selection of quality meats and cheeses, nice selection of beer and wine to  go with the sandwiches on great artisan bread.  Indoor and outdoor seating.  Really enjoyed the Americano and I'm planning to pick some of their Gouda on the way out.  Try this place out!

Wm9BfrmD-Fu_-EZcvASk6Q.text: We find quaint little spots when we are out of town and say why don't we have anything like this close to home. Now we do! Chris was wonderful to chat with. He chatted with us on some of the products they bring in. We ordered the Muffuletta and the Ruben. Both were so very good. My husband said that the cheese in the sandwich stood out. The meats in both sandwiches were some of the best we have had. The bread on the Ruben was very flavorful. The Ciabatta could have been a little less chewy, but had good flavor.  We chose the greens as our side, the dressing was amazing! We are already planning on what to order our next trip. If you need stocking stuffers for your foodie, go here for sure! I like that they have family style setting and local artist work. Thank for choosing Mathews to open shop!

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States

DUvvi5plW8bFqZZPNoWV6w.text: What a great place!  I was at a soccer game with my son and wanted to find something to eat between games.  The bacon wrapped dates with chorizo were amazing.  My son got a sandwich and I got a salad, both were very good.  Perhaps what makes this place so special is the feel created by the people that work at the market.  From the waitress who was very helpful with recommendations and the time she spent talking with me to all the staff who were pleasant and eager to help.  Lunch was so good I went back for a Ruben for my drive home and it was awesome.  Definitely going back the next time I am in Mathews.

CEoxz7c_Al5Px-ajhBJDAg.text: An odd blend of upper crust, casual, and no ambiance.  The upper crust was the cost and the knowledge of the cheese/meat, the casual was that jeans and T-shirt is fine, and the no ambiance... well, it's just sterile.  The waitress kept telling us to invite our friends and spread the word and that they need more customers -- uncomfortable.    It would be a great place if they tried to make it more comfortable (music, lighting, couches, something) and lowered the prices.

M1Lxkh3bIZpIIzdNWSMFLg.text: So excited to move to the area and find this hidden gem! A must visit for cheese lovers who want to kick back and enjoy a glass of wine, pint of beer, paired with a cheese board or alone. An assortment of cheeses to enjoy onsite or take home. The lunch menu is nice. The daily drink & food specials are well worth a visit. We enjoyed the grilled cheese and Reuben -perfect for fall. Can't wait to try Mac and Cheese night!

rR7gGV5goCL78GCIFanKKQ.text: Visited yesterday for National Grilled Cheese Day! Had a great glass of Riesling and the husband had two beers. Beers were much cheaper than expected, around $3.50 or so. I had the special of the day grilled cheese and he had the Americano. Both were delicious and fresh. Definitely looking forward to going back for a charcuterie board!

czY2pEbxh0g7THC7O_UZww.text: Loyalist is a new modern provisions market in Mathews.  They have a nice counter and ample seating for lunch and dinner.  So, I really like this type of place, I will admit ahead of time, just the setup and offerings are what I am all about.  The menu consists of meat and cheese boards, sandwiches and  a few apps and salads.  They follow that with a solid wine and beer selection, all in bottles and cans, no draft but not needed.  The alcohol is a small variety but high quality and clearly the product of someone that is making an effort to have good beer and wine.  We really enjoyed the meat and cheese plate we ordered.  The offerings were eloquently explained by our waitress.  The first thing we noticed was how plentiful the  accoutrements were on the board.  Marcona almonds, honey, lusty monk mustard, dried apricots and a few others.  It was a solid selection of two meats and three cheeses, including a smoked blue cheese that was something I have never had.  We watched what appeared to be the owner making a huge catering board that looked incredible.   I grabbed a half pound salami and Benton's bacon to go as well, the wife got some UAV ricotta.  We can't wait to go back, I love this place!

H7aPdFojtftoAjoC16ndeA.text: I've been really wanting to get one of their charcuterie boards, but so far have just been in for lunch. This is easily the best sandwich shop anywhere around this part of town, and they have a solid seating environment so you can sit and hang out. I got hooked on the chipotle chicken and bacon sandwich, but the reuben I last got was the best I've had in years. This is also a great place to grab some cheese that's much better than the nearby Harris Teeter. Highly recommend this place, and staff has always been great.

wvjOpjDcsjTBOLImIDfYLg.text: I am not sure that I have words to categorize a place like The Loyalist Market. It's a warm, friendly, soothing environment that is inviting and welcomes you with open arms.   The menu is very simple yet the foods are complex and wonderful. I will most certainly be back the muffuletta was amazing!  The staff and owner are extremely friendly!  This place is a winner for Matthews and should be enjoyed by all!

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States

ie1saezh-9ULoBJrPLdUiw.text: Went there on a Friday early evening.  Fresh/unique food menu and great draft microbrew beer prices (1/2 price on fridays).   Not a 'party place' - but a good change of pace.  I had the chipotle turkey sandwich and a good amber ale.  Wife had the grilled cheese sandwich.  We'll be back!

4ilVvAC4_fDFJw2jvEMdPw.text: At there Sunday at 11am.   Service wS quick and friendly.  My son had the muffaleta and I had the Rueben.  Both were good, but the muffuletta was exceptional.  You could really taste the quality of the meats!    We'll have to come by for charcuterie and drinks- they have a great drink/beer menu.

PdmfHm0o7vi1cCzNU8HRyA.text: Wow.  Totally blown away by this place.  I was on yelp to see something else and when I spotted a Hot New CHEESE SHOP in Matthews we were in the car ten minutes later and on our way over.  The shop itself is super cute, the people there are fabulous and friendly... and omg the food.  We had the cheese and charcuterie plate and to be honest, this was outside my comfort zone - cheese, meat, bread - all good.. but fruits, honey, nuts, jams and olives??  Not for me.. until today that is... that was the most unbelievable assortment of amazing food that never in a million years did I want to try and I would happily have it as my second choice for every meal for the rest of my life.  Second choice?  Doesn't sound like that high of praise but the ONLY reason it'd be my second choice is because I also shared THE most amazing grilled cheese I have ever had in my life.  Gouda, cheddar (lots!) all beautifully melty on this fabulous sourdough bread with pepper berry bacon jam?  YES PLEASE.  Cannot express just how good the food was and how it made just a regular old lunch feel like we'd celebrated a special occasion of some sort, but it was THAT good.    I hate to even tell anyone because full disclosure, I'm not wanting to fight for seating in my new house of worship and I know once this place catches on it'll become crazy busy, but if I keep it entirely to myself their business won't take off and I can NOT let them not make it because well, they're great people (and oh... the food... did I say?)  Wow.  Run, don't walk.  And trust me on the grilled cheese... (I cannot WAIT to go back and try the dinner menu!).

pOW0VRYe-pidHQC_TZYFJg.text: Brand new and spotless. A limited but yummy menu (try that grilled cheese!) heavy on fresh sandwiches. Watch them do it all from your barstool.  The only drawback was the lack of any diet soda. The fridge had some nifty niche drinks but nothing without sugar. It was tap water or dry mouth. Charcuterie board was exceptional.

jwnb0koIaBt8yg24b3DKgA.text: I have never had a better muffaletta in my life. Fantastic salads, charcuterie plate a real treat to share. Flavors are superb in everything.

zl6YGa-izjym-dLUQIrBTw.text: Cute shop. Very friendly staff and owner. I ordered the Fig and Pig salad and it was so delicious. They have a nice lunch menu with a variety of sandwiches that come with a side of salad or chips that range from 8-13 dollars. I also got a big chocolate chip cookie they they get locally. Love this place will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States

KVfvipt3V8J7XbSCnULWrg.text: This place is fantastic. I stopped by here on a whim after some mountain biking. What a great experience. I had the americano and a few beers. Sat outside on the patio. I loved it. My waitress offered several suggestions for beers and helped me with my questions. The owner /manager came out to ask how things were going. I will defiantly be back.

g_9IIFOFHowVbDk-YvGHZQ.text: Wonderful food with fresh ingredients!! We have been there for lunch and dinner. I had the BEST Rueben sandwich there that I ever had! Also great coffee. I'm so glad this place has come to Matthews!

wldVRaAktegEPbrKWNxRdw.text: What a great experience my first time here. Excellent wine selection and delicious appetizers. These small plates here are fabulous and much better value and selection than other places in Matthews. The staff and owner are very knowledgeable and friendly. I cant wait to visit again.

aZMYa6q9-vKWSd6oCtU--A.text: Wonderful spot in Matthews with an owner that knows his stuff.  We were very impressed with the pairings and wine by the glass is %50 off during  Wednesday happy hours from 3 to 6.  The outside seating area looks very comfortable but it was a bit too hot the day we came by to enjoy that, but next time we will sit out there. We will definitely be back!

ZrO3FRzh5PACbtGqL5mcJQ.text: What a gem!!!!  Lovely - and delicious - charcuterie board. Excellent wine and our server, Hailey, was outstanding!!!  Our new favorite place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States

Y2ZiESz3UZwBj65GdWCYmw.text: Great local place to enjoy the flavors of cheese, meats, wine and beer. Chris' passion for this place and his concept is visible. He and his staff provide great friendly service.

J0erQy3_TWzXInetzL9Pug.text: We stopped in for lunch Saturday afternoon and loved hanging out at this gorgeous, new Matthews spot. The interior is pristine, white subway tile and gleaming metal slicers as far as the eye can see. We sat at the bar and had friendly, attentive service. It was fun to watch the crew working behind the counter. The owner was even assembling a meat and cheese platter for a special order that was seriously a work of art. I even commented on how I wouldn't be able to eat the first piece, it was just so beautiful.   I enjoyed a glass of red wine and Ted downed a few IPAs. Alcohol selection was solid all around. It would be fun if they eventually got a few draughts! We shared the meat and cheese board. Everything was delicious and so thoughtfully paired. The blue cheese with oat cakes and goat milk caramel was my favorite pair. Not far behind was the salami and honey. We took a couple meats and a container of UAV ricotta home to enjoy later.   So looking forward to The Loyalist Market becoming a regular hang out spot for us. We loved it so much, I even told my husband, "I could live in Matthews."

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Lunch menu

vbWSGdk1x1Eff-vJYsA9og.text: Been here a few times already and staff goes above and beyond to answer your questions (and I had a lot of them) and make sure you have a great experience.    The wine and beer selection is varied, both on draft and what they carry in the market, which is a nice change from the IPA heavy selection in some establishments.  And let's just go ahead and mention the Mac n' cheese special on Tuesdays. I've had several items off their menu (always pleased!) and had a small meltdown when I tasted the Mac n cheese. Great flavor, tons of gooey cheese, and you can top it with smoky meat goodness (or veggies upon request).   They are known for their beautiful meat and cheese platters, but the LM offers so much more! I'm dying to try the house made ham biscuits on Sundays. I'm sure it will not disappoint!!

GhtGBsNlcECSHCSQvlS65Q.text: My husband and I just went last night and sat on their patio. We had the bacon wrapped stuffed figs and a meat and cheese platter. Seriously amazing! The perfect place to relax, have good wine and awesome food. The service was incredible. We will be back often!

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Meat and cheese platter

HOw6W-IrTNvA2wIbl_CuDQ.text: The best hidden gem!! If you haven't been here yet YOU'RE MISSING OUT!   Order the Devils on Horseback, don't even ask what's in it. I GUARANTEE you'll love them.   ALSO, the Rockin' the Beets salad is everything you ever wanted in a salad.   That's all.   You need this experience in your life.  Love,  A happy returning customer.

hGO2PJTlPxHXTOBpJaT7hw.text: Top notch find in Matthews! The Loyalist Market is a great spot for any occasion.   We went in with a group of 6 and sat at the large family style table they have inside, there is additional seating at smaller tables and at the bar. The space is clean and inviting, brightly lit with an open concept setup.   The customer service was amazing, everyone there was friendly and knowledgeable about their products. They gave great recommendations on beer, wine and of course--CHEESE.   We ordered the devils on horseback and they were delicious. Crispy, served hot and super flavorful. One order comes with 5, I absolutely recommend it.  We also ordered a cheese and charcuterie board. It was beautifully structured, and everything was great. The experience of not just eating cheese--but eating cheese paired with different items to truly enhance the taste was so fun. We loved that it was a conversation piece, everyone wanted to discuss the pairings and compare the flavor profiles etc.   Price is right on point for the quality of product you will receive.

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. One of their beautifully designed cheese board
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Devils on Horseback

UMQs1cqs_B1SL_7NKQw8xg.text: This place is so great.  The cheese board is amazing.  The staff was so friendly with this being my first time.  I will be back. Such a great place.

_U5QlmSD3BCzqFt6Gp5inA.text: The food, the wine and the service are absolutely fantastic! We  loved everything tried!

A9jEmUJANDDHSqhdp9izYw.text: I heard about this place from a coworker and decided to swing by for lunch. I ordered the charcuterie and cheese board , knowing very well I may have to take some home. Everything was delicious but my absolute favorite was the truffle tremor goat cheese paired with a side of honey to  drizzle over it. It was wonderful, my tastebuds cried, happy tears.   I think the owner was there, he was very gracious and welcoming. He explained all the items on my board. I really got the sense he had a passion for what he does.   I plan on going back after work one day soon, so I can enjoy a glass of wine with my board.

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States

7h6CzCr2AXCKPwX0J5nkxg.text: Great sandwiches and wonderful service! The rose lemonade was interesting taste and they many different beverages to choose from that are fantastic!

-hhj56clvh0fsJNq-kirAg.text: Ok, so you go in, sit down, and order. What comes next is uncommon. In fact it is unusual. It is excellence. I have been underwhelmed by many restaurants. Insulted by others. The Loyalist was extraordinary. A simple sandwich. The first on the menu. The muffuletta was crispy, full of flavor, and should not be ever changed. Tonight's wine was Qaramy Finca, an Argentinian Malbec. latranquera.co.uk/wine/2... It was a beautiful pairing. I dare anyone in 100 miles of this post to find better.

Z1T4Qd5f1CzyCg0P9wGSnQ.text: First visit was spot on with delicious sandwiches and smooth service. Second visit the same order was decidedly inferior in preparation and taste. The waitress also forgot some of our order details. Hopefully, they will get more consistent in the future.

2SaD60JoGt9xexXc6qenmg.text: This place is amazing. Everything from the charcuterie (and it's fantastic pairings) to the sandwiches are extremely well done with great ingredients but they really know cheese and have a huge selection of it.  Every cheese comes with a recommended accoutrement that takes it up a notch. The big board comes with enough selection that you can experiment with different combinations. It's very clear that the severes are required to know the cheeses they serve and are able to talk about them as well as give their own personal recommendations.   A large wine selection and a good mix of local beers with some unique selections from further away work with the casual, slightly hipster atmosphere complete the experience. This place is a local gem

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. The big board. Simply fantastic. Word of caution: it&#39;ll make you want to take home a jar of jam, olives and goat&#39;s milk caramel.

5A6RvZJlIGDdHa-OAFAjXw.text: Great local spot in downtown Matthews.  Friendly, laid back atmosphere.  They specialize in cheese and charcuterie options but also have sandwich and small plates.  The owner Christopher has a background in charcuterie and is qualified to give good wine selection combinations.  For lunch, i tried the Queens Charlotte Pimento Cheese sandwich special.  It was delicious!   They have a small grocery selection with items such as jams, gourmet crackers, etc. You can tell from talking to the staff that a lot of research and thought has gone into selecting the items they sell.  Look for wine tasting events as well.

jZVIC7wGsUDqtHW3A1OJiw.text: Although this place is a bit difficult to find, it was worth it. The muffuletta was good ask for the spicy mustard on the side.

g4XrNaEN9xaGayI4zLBJrg.text: This place is amazing. My boyfriend and I had the Muffuletta sandwich and Chipotle Turkey Sandwich. What a great explosion of flavors. They also sell cheeses and deli meats. Next time I visit, I will be trying the charcuterie board. Sorry no pictures, I ate my food and forgot.

iqZjr8LSzs_IvmKry32T9Q.text: Loved it-much needed in Matthews, beer, wine, charcuterie tray, artisan sandwiches, and grocery/deli to go. Cool new ingredients in the grilled cheese, tapenade muffuletta, and kettle chips   Parking lot, casual dress, super nice owners, sit at bar, communal table or outside.

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Fun wacky beers to try, charcuterie tray, and artisan sandwiches-loved the muffuletta and the grilled cheese.

9WJ1bDWDyZ_Ol3veKtWqBw.text: AMAZING food and the price is right, actually, better than right.  What a gem!  I will be back and include pictures.  Devil on horseback is truly a delight for the palette.  Marinated olives are delicious, salads were a hit as was the grilled cheese.  Everything was fresh and made in house.  Spectacular!!

OfYjashXdqVDbOhkXG60bg.text: Great place and an owner who is always paying attention to details.  Highly recommend

514WyBQ4nBGUbo6rNlYQIQ.text: Hands down favorite cheese shop (and I'm a self proclaimed cheese enthusiast) the owner and his staff taking cheese so personally it truly takes the cheese (see what I did there ) they have a forever changing selection, a half price day for rose and a grilled cheese that could change your whole life. This place alone is worth the trek out to Matthews and the atmosphere welcomes even the most casual crowd.

1ikxIbdCWMMmKAMWjPf2ow.text: Finally got around to checking out The Loyalist. Great selection of charcuterie, sandwiches, salads and starters. We had the charcuterie and cheese board which came with 3 cheeses, 2 meats and pairings. The bacon wrapped dates with cheese are crazy good. There is also a good selection of beer and wine at fair prices. They also have some market items to go.  The service is incredible. They were informative on the charcuterie selections and the food prep was fairly quick.  Would like it more if they had a larger to go beer and wine selection.

uyjYmQoxzi50rc1FgoKhQw.text: Wow!  My husband and I had an amazing lunch at The Loyalist.  The chicken salad tasted so fresh and it was served with arugula normally on a croissant, but they accommodated my request for sourdough. After a week in Savannah, I wanted a soup without cream and was I in luck!  They offered a vegetable soup for a small upcharge and it was well worth it.    My husband had the chipotle turkey bacon sandwich and I know he enjoyed it because his plate was perfectly clean. We can't wait to go back and have wine and cheese one cooler evening.  My husband, who is a music lover, noted that I must add that the playlist is the best in Charlotte.  In his words, he says it's straight "FI-YA"!!!!

lJP5_ZKNAJhxu-ZlhGjNbw.text: I LOVE this place!!  I have been here before and could eat here every day.  The warm olives and the ricotta are a great way to start. There are several different textures and flavors from the different olives and the herb oil is great drizzle on the bread with ricotta.  The ricotta had good flavor but was not as creamy as our last visit.  The charcuterie and cheese board is on another level. Each item has a perfect pairing and each is explained in detail as is the origins of each item.  The staff here is super friendly and amazingly knowledgeable about the meats and cheeses.  Next visit I really need to try a sandwich I saw many and they all looked delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Each selection has an expertly selected accompaniment
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Charcuterie and Cheese
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Marinated warm olives and ricotta

klVBOdsio6k9_5jSzOCe1w.text: The Loyalist Market is a quaint, small, local cut to order cheese and charcuterie shop. They carry 40 styles of artisan cheese and can make over 20 styles of charcuterie.   They operate as a sandwich shop during the day and they run the same menu each day. They offer a variety of local beers, ciders and wine. They also have some desserts in addition to sandwiches and they sell local goods and products as well. On Thursday evenings they will put on a class program. I came here for a cheese tasting class with the Piedmont Culinary Guild. The owner was very knowledgeable about the different types of  cheeses. All of the cheeses we tasted were from NC creameries. They are the only Matthews based triple crown sustainability company in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Cheese tasting class for the Piedmont Culinary Guild.

SWq5Rl_sbmprVrGWc9uMaQ.text: This was such a cool spot tucked in off the Main Street of Downtown Matthews. I had seen this place popping up nonstop on my IG feed with dozens of incredible pictures of charcuterie boards.   Being a huge fan I knew I had to test to see if the food was as good as the pictures and it definitely measured up. I got a medium sized charcuterie board (two meats and three cheeses) for $24- a well priced combo. I wish I had went with the big board however!  The place has a really cool vibe and posted outdoor seating, but the weather didn't permit us to sit outside. The place is a bit tight however and I can imagine it gets pretty cramped when full, so be sure to arrive prompt if you plan to show up during peak hours. Really friendly and knowledgeable staff!

C15uz-FICylNsXtxthOhhA.text: What a beautiful, sunny April day for our first lunch visit to this wildly popular eatery on the edge of downtown Matthews. We were immediately greeted by its passionate owner, Chris, the moment we walked thru the door, and our waitress was equally friendly and attentive throughout our meal.   The Rockin' the Beets (with goat cheese) salad  was loaded with beef chunks and was easily substantial as a meal, as was the Fig and Pig. Both were priced at $9 and were very fresh and packed with quality ingredients. The housemade dressings were also fabulous.   We split a small Charcouterie and Cheese board including two cured meats, three cheeses, gourmet mustard and preserves, Spanish almonds and dried mango, all beautifully presented. It ran $23 and was a very tasty appetizer but could serve as a meal for light eaters. It is also their specialty. I also tried a gourmet grilled cheese and chips for $8.   Like everything else it was exceptional! The atmosphere inside and out was comfortable, light and airy. Everything was immaculate. I give it out many 5-star ratings but this is one. Can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Patio

YH0dJxqyqP1URUTcOXRoDg.text: This was SUCH A cute trendy delicious place. I was nearby reading at a coffee shop and needed lunch. They're sandwiches are all so fresh and delicious and anyone would be remiss to pass this place by.

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Fig, ricotta, and balsamic glaze that was TO DIE FOR.
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. The original gangster and side salad
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. The Original Gangster

vhGQkKx1jAhoWHzAE5wSRA.text: Once I opened the door the delicious smell of the tomamto basil dressing went through me. I love places like this with local provisions. It's a very cute little place with bar seating, a couple tables, and outdoor seating. I sat at the long community table. They have lots of local wines and brews from Asheville to Southern Pines as well as canned items like Mexican coke and ginger ale. I had sweet tea and it was just the right amount of sugar. Once I saw muffuletta that was it for me. Along side I wanted the mixed greens with that tomato basil dressing. It def didn't look like a typical muffuletta but the taste was BANGING! The service was just amazing also. I really felt like I was at home. What I thought would be a really good salad ended up being mouth watering with that tomato basil dressing. I finished most everything and got to go what I didn't. Later on I will be trying the lemon cream cake because I just couldn't resist leaving with out something sweet. Thank you Loyalist that was an amazing lunch!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Muffelatta with mixed greens and tomato basil dressing

QSX2_QHZ_rcfD7_RiQxwwQ.text: I came here on a Sunday for the first time. It wasn't busy and we found a table right away. They have indoor and outdoor seating. The place is beautiful, new, crisp, clean. It makes you feel welcomed. The man begins the counter greeted us right away and was very friendly.   They have drink specials everyday and Sunday is $5 mimosas. They have a large sandwich menu and is a nice place to have lunch. We ordered the cheese and charcuterie board. They select the items for you. I liked everything except one of the cheeses.   They only gave us 4 pieces of bread, which I don't think is enough. I liked the bread, but honestly prefer a crispy crostini type bread with cheese and charcuterie. In my opinion, it just goes better.   The service was good and I would return again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Mimosas

fMoi1DSRJZOyE4A5KdGpnQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place for almost a year but waited until we had a beautiful spring morning so that I could sit outside and sip some $5 mimosas. The patio is very large and the umbrellas are a nice touch on a sunny day. Three of us shared a cheese and meat board and some mimosas. I was surprised by the limited wine selection and would love to see some more on there as well as the option for a tasting of wine and cheese together. The staff was helpful and knowledgeable. Overall, the place is simple and sufficient. I like the area and there's plenty of parking. I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Cheese and meat board
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Large outdoor space

dHU8F2G6TG4ikn6AjSjTjQ.text: This place has potential but missed the mark. Atmosphere is nice. We went 1:30p on a Friday.  Not very busy.  There were 4-5 employees watched us enter...no greeting. Finally acknowledged and seated. Staff seems disorganized and inexperienced.  Sandwich (Rueben) was adequate. Salad was from a bag...yuck.  Average at best.

Hz8iV61p4TQMj7co3ghPpQ.text: This was my first visit. When we walked in we were greeted right away by the owner/manager. He was very welcoming and kind.   We grabbed a seat in the back and checked out the menu. I decided to enjoy a mimosa and it was quite tasty. We ordered a large meat and cheese plate. I enjoyed the way they added compliments to all of the cheeses and meats. I also appreciate that they made special accommodations to my nut allergy.   Overall, this was a nice place. If I'm in the area again, I'd definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States

2saJaFAlIAAaeO_As-CXiQ.text: Ah, Sadly I can't give The Loyalist five stars even when I LOVE this place. Out of the last five times I've been here, the lackluster service during the last three visits have been disappointing.   The food is great and the owner is passionate about locally made ingredients/foods. The first two times having dinner here were great. The server was kind and helpful, food was fresh and delicious. I loved it so much I kept coming back.   Then, these past three visits when I've raved about The Loyalist to friends. The service was terrible. We had to ask for everything we needed or track another server down to help us a couple of times.   Tonight, I noticed a couple leave while waiting for our table. My friend and I were trying to paying our check to give them the table, but the server did not check on us. The couple left.  I'm writing this review because I want people to not leave due to poor service. I love The Loyalist...location, food, and I hope to love the service again.

ZeENlUMU0yPpf-ge8U09_g.text: It is my pleasure to give a five-star rating to this beautiful little spot in Matthews.  The food was soooooooo good (best grilled cheese sandwich I've ever had and way more than just plain old grilled cheese), the wine was perfect (and there were lots of choices, plus beer, too), the owner is very present and cares about his customers - and is delightful and knowledgeable to talk with, and, while the service is a mite slow (it was a very busy Friday night), the staff could not be nicer or more attentive.  I don't live in Matthews any longer, but I can't wait to go back to The Loyalist.  It's a perfect place to relax and unwind!

qot3M2qTnaYpXIosyCJx9Q.text: After seeing some amazing photos of their Charcuterie Trays, I immediately bookmarked The Loyalist Market in Yelp, joined their Instagram and Facebook accounts and counted down until my visit.  A quaint shop in Matthews, The Loyalist Market provides outstanding service, unique dishes and some of the best Charcuterie I have ever had.  This market offers customers the ability to order meats and cheeses/sandwiches to go, a menu if you'd like to dine in and a bar to boot. I stopped in on a Sunday afternoon only to realize there was a ham sandwich and mimosa special. Although the ham sandwich, on a homemade biscuit, looked and sounded amazing I had to go with a Charcuterie Tray on my first visit. And, it did not disappoint.  The Tray came with two meats and three cheeses, crostini and some accompaniments. They lay the Tray out so you use each accompaniment with the appropriate cheese, perfection! I honestly can say that the way they pair things really makes you appreciate the taste of the cheese. Hats off to them.  This is a stop that I would highly recommend if you like Charcuterie, great service and a quaint location!

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Cheese &amp; Charcuterie Board
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. $5.00 Mimosas on Sunday

ncRRv0bYzrR-23toAlVdyw.text: The area where the market is located has grown up quite a bit over the years - so it is quite impressive that it has gone from, well, nothing, to being a chain or two, to actually having some reasonable choices.  As to the market itself - it is a bit disjointed as you enter, but the staff is friendly and can help you out. This mostly stems from it depending on when you enter, and we came just as they were switching over. If you are there a bit earlier, you get something at the counter (the "market"), and then go grab a seat - or take your stuff to go.  If you come later, for more of a dinner experience perhaps, then you will sit and be waited upon, in more of a traditional experience. Though it's not quite traditional, because you aren't sitting in a restaurant or anything. It's more like you're a part of the market itself. There are a couple of tables and a larger, shared table.  Said staff mills about, so you may be helped by several people, who get your drinks and bring whatever you will order throughout your stay. The more interesting choices are likely to be the meat and cheese options - what is probably most unique is that you don't have a bunch of input other than the number. A couple next to us ordered the exact same thing, and other than some bread, I am not sure they had anything on their tray that was the same as ours. Most looked a lot different.  You may also want to stay away from the web site, specifically if you are looking for something specific on your tray. While they may carry, say, some cheese from time to time, the very nature of seasonal cheeses means it may not be there on your visit. This isn't bad, and doesn't mean what you get will be bad - just don't be surprised is all.  Other items, such as sandwiches and the like, aren't likely to change much, but be honest - the cheese and meat trays are where it's at.

7iFxUuvxl_B2evxfRXRLSg.text: Wonderful cheese selection.  Restaurant is clean but has limited indoor seating.  There is some outdoor seating.  My only problem was they do not serve diet sodas.  They do have mexican cola.  Food was good.  Service is a little on the slower side.  They do have take out.

weGagixkJ4pWkBDiv_RhNA.text: I had brunch here on Sunday March 24th with my sister in law and two girlfriends... we had mimosas, a cheese board, and salads on the patio to celebrate a lovely Sunday morning!  We were early, so we just loitered on the patio... the second they opened, the staff came out with water and menus to ask what we'd like... They were super kind and made us feel right at home!  I'm sure, had we not had to drive, we'd have spent all afternoon day-drinking in that pretty place!!  The cheeseboard was a spectacle of delicious cheeses and meats paired with jams, honeys, dried fruits, and nuts.  We really enjoyed how knowledgeable they were about their cheese and charcuterie!  I also got the Fig & Pig salad... a delight of salty and sweet natural flavors... I can't wait to get back here!! :)

sbTmrD5jm6ibD26fjO8GBg.text: One of my favorite places in Matthews. The staff is so helpful and awesome and knowledgeable. I am always excited to come here with big groups or just myself. Incredible selection of meat and cheese for the boards and the environment is awesome to just sit and eat with a group. Also, if you get a chance to try their mac n cheese on Tuesdays, just do it. So so good!

IOrXMU4dCvaQNuLsJcG-BQ.text: This is one of my most favorite spots in downtown Matthews. Wonderful quality of cheese's and meats. Great sandwiches and salads. I love the pig n fig salad. My husband loves the Chipotle turkey sandwich. We have had charcuterie boards there and order them to go, they're always amazing. The $5 mimosas are great on Sundays. I highly recommend this establishment.

XkeXFppXV86zvMMHWMKLQQ.text: This place was so delicious we went twice on our Charlotte vacation! We both ordered the turkey sandwich with chipotle and bacon. Plus the beer selection was fantastic and we got the most delicious cookie. They have a ton of food and drink options plus a great outdoor space! Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Turkey chipotle sandwich
Photo of The Loyalist Market - Matthews, NC, United States. Blonde ale
